page.title: 12Shropshire Union Canal
page.content: The Shropshire Union Canal was built by Thomas Telford. It joins the Manchester Ship Canal at Ellesmere Port and goes to the heart of the West Midlands. There are 46 locks on the main canal. The canal was opened in 1836. We went to the Boat Inn by the canal. There were lots of boats. We went under number 35 bridge. Perhaps the bridge numbers help the people on the barges to navigate. We found out that barges went the opposite way to the cars on the road. The names of some of the barges we saw were Salten Fjord, Christina, Desert Express and Rite of Spring. I do think these are strange names. As we came near to the second bridge the canal seemed to get narrower. Before the bridge it is wide enough for 3 barges but under the bridge it is only wide enough for one
